thread.title: P.K. Subban gushes support for playoff-bound Blue Jays
thread.title_full: P.K. Subban gushes support for playoff-bound Blue Jays

title: P.K. Subban gushes support for playoff-bound Blue Jays
text:
Report an error TORONTO - 
Sitting in a private box at the Air Canada Centre, Marcus Stroman, like many of his Blue Jay teammates, wore a Maple Leafs jersey to opening night of the NHL season. 
But there was one exception. 
Sticking out in this sea of blue was Australian pitcher Liam Hendriks, who was decked out in Habs bleu blanc rouge for the Canadiens 3-1 victory over the Maple Leafs in the curtain raiser of the 2015-16 campaign. 
What gives here? Who put Hendriks up to this? 
Look no further than P.K. Subban, the Toronto-area native Leaf fans love to hate. 
Meeting with reporters afterward, Subban came clean. Indeed, he was responsible. 
“I got a Subban shirt for (Hendriks) today, so we did a little trade.” 
Nice shout out to the Blue Jays from the Leafs. Don't stay out to late- there's a game tomorrow. pic.twitter.com/w1R7s2Ao20 — Nick Maiorano (@nickm1010) October 8, 2015 

In return, Hendriks gave the flamboyant Habs defenceman a customized “Subbanator 76” Blue Jays jersey, something Subban very much cherishes with the Jays poised to kick off their 2015 American League Divisional Series against the Texas Rangers at Rogers Centre Thursday afternoon. 
“It’s great,” Subban said. “I support them. These guys, they should be supported. They should be on the Jumbotron. We should be supporting them and being positive about all these guys because what they’re doing is great. 
“As someone being from Toronto, in 1992 and ‘93, I wasn’t really old enough to witness and appreciate some serious playoff baseball. This is an exciting time of the year for anyone who is a serious baseball fan. And it’s a great time of the year for anyone who’s from Toronto.”
